result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Pete Bates

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie Pete Bates not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Willie Pete Bates.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 12-7-22 at 2:30 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Willie Pete Bates not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Willie Pete Bates.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they are still awaiting discovery materials from the State. Defense, further requests an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Br 10.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Willie Pete Bates appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Willie Pete Bates.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DRS (DOB: 11/30/1968) and Co-Defendant
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Pete Bates appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Hotchkiss appeared by video for Willie Pete Bates.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
Preliminary Hearing Scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00AM. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
